title: Biomimicry: When Nature Designs Better Than Humans
description: Learn Biomimicry: When Nature Designs Better Than Humans in one minute.

hook.text: Velcro was invented after a Swiss engineer noticed burrs sticking to his dog's fur. Nature solved grip first.

discovery.text: Kingfisher beaks inspired bullet trains. Termite mounds inspired ventilation. Shark skin inspired swimsuits.

twist.text: Janine Benyus coined 'biomimicry' in 1997, but humans copied nature for millennia â€” Leonardo sketched bird wings.

climax.text: The Eastgate Centre in Zimbabwe uses termite-mound ventilation, cutting energy use by 90% versus conventional.

punchline.text: Nature already solved most design problems. We just need to look.
